      • fragmentTests

        public void fragmentTests()
        "Basic" edit operations that (mostly) affect a single layer.
        1. Label changes, both below and above original status
        2. Annotation insertion
        3. Annotation deletion
        4. Anchor offset changes, both below and above original status
        5. Connected graphs that become disconnected, on the same layer
        6. Disconnected graphs that become connected, on the same layer
        7. Annotation transposition
        8. Merge graphs with partial hierarchy - e.g. an utterance - and check for correct ordinals
        Then "Rel" tests: edits that have inter-layer consequences.
        1. Parents - for saturated relationships, child anchors trump parent anchors
        2. Label changes, with unaligned children
        3. Label changes, with aligned children (to ensure they don't get given default alignments)
        4. New annotations that share anchors with old annotations on another layer - e.g. insert a word at the beginning of a language block
        5. Peers - anchor changes on annotations are reflected in their unaligned peer tags, when the peer layer isn't present in the edited fragment
        6. Peers - anchor changes on annotations are reflected in their unaligned peer tags, when the peer layer is present in the edited fragment
        Then "Align" tests: edits that have more complicated possible consequences.
        1. New annotations that share anchors with old annotations on another layer, where new anchors are lower status than old ones - e.g. insert a word at the beginning of a language block
        2. Annotation insertion - works if the low-status new offsets for surrounding anchors are a long way away from their high-status originals (i.e. if a manually aligned utterance has words clustered at the beginning, and a new word is inserted as the second-to-last word, and the edited annotations have default alignments, it comes out in the wash)
        Then "Htk" tests: edits that simulate HTK
        1. simple alignment with no segments
        2. simple alignment with no segments, but will parallel annotations on other layers
        3. simple alignment with prior default segments
        4. simple re-alignment with prior aligned segments
        5. re-alignment with different segments - add/change/delete
        6. re-alignment avoiding manual alignments
        7. re-alignment avoiding manual alignments, where differences are big enough to create an invalid graph. e.g.
          • original: .1.2. !3!4!5.6. (manually aligned .4.5.6.)
          • edited: . .1.2.3.4. .5.6. (order would be changed
          • result: .1.2. !3!4!5.6. (keep order)
          • not: .1.2. .5.6.!3!4! (keep alignments)
        8. also test conflicting alignments in the other direction. e.g.
          • original: .1.2.!3!4! .5.6. (manually aligned .4.5.6.)
          • edited: . .1.2.3.4. .5.6. (order would be changed
          • result: .1.2.!3!4! .5.6. (keep order)
          • not: !3!4! .1.2. .5.6. (keep alignments)
        Then "Reupload" tests: edits that simulate re-upload
        1. unaligned word edits to aligned words
        2. unaligned word edits to aligned words with aligned segments
        3. unaligned word/language edits to aligned words with aligned segments
        4. move unaligned word to another utterance, with previously aligned words
        5. change utterance alignments, with previously aligned words, to create mid-word utterance boundary
        6. merge utterances
        7. split utterances
        Then test merge of graphs with mismatched granularities, to simulate exporting to TextGrid and then re-importing.

      • graphTests

        public void graphTests()
        Test edits that simulate re-upload
        1. Change turn alignments, with previously aligned words, to create mid-word turn boundary
        2. Changing parents - move word to neighbouring turn with different speaker
        3. Peers - parent changes on annotations are reflected in aligned and unaligned peers
        4. Changing parents - move unaligned word to another turn, with previously aligned words
        5. Changing parents - move unaligned word to a simultaneous turn
        6. Changing parents - merge two turns (delete intervening other-speaker turn)
        7. Changing parents - split a turn in two (insert intervening other-speaker turn)

      • tests

        public void tests​(String sDir,
                  String log)
        Standardised method for running graph fragment tests based on files in the test directory.
        Parameters:
        sDir - Subdirectory name
        log - null, or a filename substring like "001" to identify a test for which to switch on debug logging.

        public Schema defaultSchema()
        Returns the default schema for testing.
        Returns:
        A test schema that matches the test files.

      • loadGraphFromJSON

        public Graph loadGraphFromJSON​(File file,
                               Schema schema)
                        throws FileNotFoundException,
                               IOException,
                               SerializationException,
                               SerializationParametersMissingException,
                               SerializerNotConfiguredException
        Loads an annotation graph from a JSON file.
        Parameters:
        file - The JSON file.
        schema - The schema to use.
        Returns:
        The annotation graph represented by the file.
        Throws:
        SerializationException - If the graph could not be loaded.
        SerializationParametersMissingException
        SerializerNotConfiguredException
        IOException - On IO error.
        FileNotFoundException - If file doesn't exist.
